type.name: org.gradle.api.initialization.ProjectDescriptor
type.description:
A ProjectDescriptor declares the configuration required to create and evaluate a org.gradle.api.Project.

A ProjectDescriptor is created when you add a project to the build from the settings script, using Settings#include(String[]) or Settings#includeFlat(String[]). You can access the descriptors using one of the lookup methods on the Settings object.

method.name: getBuildFile
method.description:
Returns the build file for this project.

returns:The build file. Never returns null.

method.name: getBuildFileName
method.description:
Returns the name of the build file for this project. This name is interpreted relative to the project directory.

returns:The build file name.

method.name: getChildren
method.description:
Returns the children of this project, if any.

returns:The children. Returns an empty set if this project does not have any children.

method.name: getName
method.description:
Returns the name of this project.

returns:The name of the project. Never returns null.

method.name: getParent
method.description:
Returns the parent of this project, if any. Returns null if this project is the root project.

returns:The parent, or null if this is the root project.

method.name: getPath
method.description:
Returns the path of this project. The path can be used as a unique identifier for this project.

returns:The path. Never returns null.

method.name: getProjectDir
method.description:
Returns the project directory of this project.

returns:The project directory. Never returns null.

method.name: setBuildFileName
method.description:
Sets the name of the build file. This name is interpreted relative to the project directory.
param:name The build file name. Should not be null.

method.name: setName
method.description:
Sets the name of this project.
param:name The new name for the project. Should not be null

method.name: setProjectDir
method.description:
Sets the project directory of this project.
param:dir The new project directory. Should not be null.

property.name: buildFile
property.description:
Returns the build file for this project.

returns:The build file. Never returns null.

property.name: buildFileName
property.description:
Returns the name of the build file for this project. This name is interpreted relative to the project directory.

returns:The build file name.

property.name: children
property.description:
Returns the children of this project, if any.

returns:The children. Returns an empty set if this project does not have any children.

property.name: name
property.description:
Returns the name of this project.

returns:The name of the project. Never returns null.

property.name: parent
property.description:
Returns the parent of this project, if any. Returns null if this project is the root project.

returns:The parent, or null if this is the root project.

property.name: path
property.description:
Returns the path of this project. The path can be used as a unique identifier for this project.

returns:The path. Never returns null.

property.name: projectDir
property.description:
Returns the project directory of this project.

returns:The project directory. Never returns null.
